question: Can you plan a week-long road trip itinerary from San Francisco to Los Angeles, highlighting interesting stops along the way?
true_answer: A week-long itinerary from San Francisco to Los Angeles includes stops at Santa Cruz, Monterey Bay, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, and Malibu.

steps.description: Research interesting stops along the route

plan.current_objective: Create a detailed itinerary for a road trip from San Francisco to Los Angeles

memory_state.shared_knowledge: Trip duration is one week. Notable stops include Santa Cruz, Monterey Bay, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, Malibu.

steps.content: Can you plan a week-long road trip itinerary from San Francisco to Los Angeles, highlighting interesting stops along the way?
Creating initial plan: 1) Define trip parameters, 2) Determine stops, 3) Develop itinerary.
Decomposing task into defining route, researching stops, and day-by-day itinerary creation.
Assigning route definition and interesting stops research to researcher.
Searching for popular tourist attractions and scenic routes between San Francisco and Los Angeles.
Identified key stops: Santa Cruz, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Hearst Castle, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, Malibu beaches.
Marking route and stops research complete. Updating shared knowledge.
Drafting day-by-day itinerary, considering travel time and exploration at each stop.
Itinerary suggests: Day 1 in Santa Cruz, Day 2-3 in Monterey, Day 4 in San Luis Obispo, Day 5 in Santa Barbara, Day 6-7 in Malibu and Los Angeles.
Incorporating itinerary feedback and finalizing route plan.
A week-long itinerary from San Francisco to Los Angeles includes stops at Santa Cruz, Monterey Bay, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, and Malibu.
